value.title: Epic and Microsoft expand AI partnership to 'address healthcare's most pressing needs'

value.title: Two-thirds of professionals think AI will increase their skills' value
value.excerpt: Of the professionals surveyed, 64% said they expect their professional skills to be "more highly prized" over the next five years. Twenty-four percent of those respondents see that positive change occurring in the next 18 months while 40% see it happening between 18 months and five years from now.

value.title: Machine learning with decentralized training data using federated learning on Amazon SageMaker
value.excerpt: In this post, we discuss how to implement federated learning on Amazon SageMaker to run ML with decentralized training data.

value.title: Meta Releases SeamlessM4T AI Model to Translate Languages in Real-Time
value.excerpt: For the SeamlessM4T model, Meta researchers said in a research paper that they gathered audio training data from 4 million hours of "raw audio originating from a publicly available repository of crawled web data," without specifying which repository.

value.title: Chip designer Arm looks to ride the AI boom with the biggest US IPO since 2021
value.excerpt: Arm's planned IPO, which hopes to raise up to $10 billion, is set to be the largest US listing since Rivian fetched over $12 billion in October 2021.

value.title: Meta Platforms announces new AI model for speech and text translations
value.excerpt: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) announced an AI model that can transcribe and translate nearly 100 languages. SeamlessM4T is the company's first multimodal and multilingual AI translation model that allows people to communicate through speech and text across different languages.

value.title: Retail Redefined: AI's Affinity For Personalized Engagement

value.title: Bosses and workers are worried about new technology like AI, but for different reasons
value.excerpt: Execs are planning to invest in generative AI, but employees are nervous these new tools will put them out of work.

value.title: AI Is Remixing Music—But The DJ Is Still A Human
value.excerpt: The truth is that successful, AI-generated art will still require a human touch. Despite its ability to automate tasks and generate images, AI (for now) is still limited by the abilities and decisions of the people responsible for its creation, editing and programming.

value.title: Does Your Business Need Protection From AI?
value.excerpt: While AI can offer many benefits to companies, there are also potential dangers you need to address to protect your business and its stakeholders.

value.title: IBM Watsonx to use generative AI to translate COBOL code into Java

value.title: Will generative AI make the digital twin promise real in the energy and utilities industry?
value.excerpt: A digital twin is the digital representation of a physical asset. It uses real-world data (both real time and historical) combined with engineering, simulation or machine learning (ML) models to enhance operations and support human decision-making.
